intro: Viola biflora var. valdepilosa, commonly known as the Valdepiña violet, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of violet-blue flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers typically bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
